events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred on the morning of April 30th involving their vehicle and another party at an intersection.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident cluster after reviewing the initial report and keywords related to vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim and to facilitate next steps in the process.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and confirmed that the investigation will begin shortly.
Customer was asked to provide photos of vehicle damage, police report, and medical receipts related to the auto collision.
Customer submitted all requested documents including detailed photos, report from the police, and an estimate for car repairs.
Investigation team began reviewing all submitted evidence and contacted the other party involved in the collision for their statement.
The investigation concluded that the customer was not at fault in the accident and that damages are covered under the policy.
A settlement amount covering full repair costs and related expenses was proposed to the customer for approval and feedback.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the communication and timely handling.
The insurance claim was officially approved following customer acceptance of the settlement offer and internal review.
Payment covering the approved settlement amount was issued to the customerâ€™s account to facilitate the repair of the vehicle.
The auto accident claim was formally closed after confirmation that the customer received payment and began vehicle repairs.
